description:
Description

This easy chair designed by Børge Mogensen's son, architect Peter Mogensen, comfortably amplifies his father's 1960s furniture series. Echoing the geometric concept of the original sofa 2333, the lines are crisp and the cushioning squared-off while the inner side cushions sit embracingly upright and parallel to the armrests. Timeless in its appeal, the lounge chair offers upholstery in premium leather and textile selections to harmonize with choice of finishes for the solid-oak legs.

name: Mogensen 6284 Dining Table
description:
Description

Børge Mogensen’s 6284 Table from 1958 embodies his desire for longevity in a restrained aesthetic, made from the finest selection of solid oak available in a variety of finishes. Inspired by the functional, utilitarian approach of the Shaker movement, his aim was to create beautiful, distinctive furniture by emphasizing simple horizontal and vertical lines and surfaces. That restrained manner imbues the structural beauty of the versatile table’s angled leg support and joinery with a modest appearance intended to create a sense of tranquillity.

Description

In the 1940s post-war optimism for the future, designer Børge Mogensen was lauded for his clever daybed-chaise hybrid with a hinged side at the influential exhibit of the Copenhagen Cabinetmakers’ Guild.
